damageImmunities: Lightning Heals for half the damage and energizes him

system.description: • Your Ability Point Max is 30 instead of 20.

• You can't age, can't die due to age, and suffer none of the effects of old age.

  • Your power cannot benefit from magical bonuses to your ability scores, AC, attack and damage rolls, proficiency bonus, saving throws, or spell save DC.

    • Other magical effects, such as increased speed or advantage on saving throws against spells, apply as normal

    • Magic items of Legendary or Artifact rarity ignore this limit.
• Káshi aligns with evil and therefore Hákarl does Necrotic Damage whenever a feature refers to Divine Damage Type.

• While influenced by Káshi your Strength Ability Score increases by +1.

    • You use your Strength Ability Score when calculating your saving throw for features from this class (1d8 + Prof Bonus) and whenever a feature calls for your Divine Ability score. 

    • Some features may call for a spell attack roll, your ability score for your spell attack rolls is Strength.

• If a creature is bleeding you can smell them from 60 feet away.

    • This is increased to 120 feet while fully submerged in water.

• Can sense movement and noise and get a perfect picture of your surroundings even when blinded up to 30 feet out.

    • Electroreception

      • While fully submerged in water, electroreceptors in your snout allow you to feel the vibrations around you, so much so that you can sense muscles contract at 60 feet away.

• Aquatic Demigod Residence

    • Resistant to cold damage.

    • Immune to lightning damage.

      • In fact, he heals half of the damage dealt and it energizes him.

      • Still counts as damage as far as fueling Rage is considered.

  • Necromancer's Creation

    • Vulnerable to radiant damage.

These tools allow you to turn a specific type of raw material into generic trade goods using your time, effort, and skill. The type of tool determines the materials and amount of time needed. After spending the needed time and materials, you make a profession check with those tools which determines the value of the resulting generic trade goods (on a result of 15 or lower the materials used are wasted).

Material: 1 sp of stone

Time: 1 week (8 hours per day)

DC Value
15 10 gp
20 30 gp
25+ 50 gp

Includes:

  • 1x Backpack

  • 1x Bedroll

  • 1x Mess Tin

  • 1x Tinderbox

  • 10x Torch

  • 10x Rations (1 Supply)

  • 1x Waterskin

  • 1x Rope, Hempen (50 Feet)
• Can hold his breath for an hour.

O4OMvI5mATJsWMAY.name: Claw Slash
O4OMvI5mATJsWMAY.description: • Hákarl slashes with his claws at an enemy.

system.description:
• Hákarl slashes with his claws at an enemy.

    • Attack: Natural Melee Attack.

    • Reach: 5 ft.

    • Hit: Demigod Level + 2d4 slashing damage.

O4OMvI5mATJsWMAY.name: Earsplitting Roar
O4OMvI5mATJsWMAY.description: • You unsettle opponents with a dreadful roar.

system.description:
• You unsettle opponents with a dreadful roar.

    • Once per short/long rest, you may produce a roar as a bonus action that is so powerful it causes Hákarl 1d4 thunder damage.

      • Your mighty roar shakes the very air around you, causing every opponent within 30 feet of you that can hear your roar and has a character level lower than yours to second guess facing you.

        • The affected opponents must make a successful Will save (DC 10 + your Cha modifier) to negate the effect.

          • Success means they only take the 1d4 thunder damage.
          • Failure means the opponent becomes shaken for 1d6 rounds.

            • A shaken creature takes a -2 morale penalty on attack rolls, checks, and saving throws toward/against you.

• Hákarl bites down on the enemy and locks his jaw.

    • Attack: Natural melee Weapon Attack

    • Hit: 1d4 + Strength modifier in piercing damage

    • Reach: 5 ft.

    • Effect: The creature becomes grappled until Hákarl unhinges his jaw, is knocked unconscious, or fails a strength contest.

      • Hákarl gains advantage during the strength contest.

        • On a success, he is torn free and his serrated teeth tear chunks out of their body, causing 1d6 piercing damage and causing them to Bleed.

        • On a failure, he remains locked on and does 1d6 piercing damage per round.

• When starting fully submerged in water, Hákarl may leap 20 feet into the air, or take a lunge forward to land at a distance of 40 feet

    • If Pounce is utilized during this leap, they cannot roll a save against being knocked prone.

      • Lethal Jaws becomes a free action immediately following against the creature being Pounced upon.

O4OMvI5mATJsWMAY.name: Tail Whip Attack
O4OMvI5mATJsWMAY.description:
• You may use your tail to powerfully strike your enemies to knock them prone.

      • If the target succeeds, you may bring the tail back to strike again without expending its use.

        • Essentially you have advantage on the roll

system.description:
• You may use your tail to powerfully strike a creature within 5 feet of you to knock them prone.

    • The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength Modifier.

      • On a failure, the target will be knocked prone until your next turn and take 1d6 + Strength Modifier in force damage.

      • On a success the target avoids the strike.

        • If the target succeeds, you may bring the tail back to strike again without expending its use.

          • Essentially you have advantage on the roll

    • You may only successfully use this ability 1 + your proficiency bonus per short/long rest.

• When you suffer bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, you may reduce that damage by half as a reaction.

    • While Raging, you may reduce this damage to 0.

      • This still counts as “damage” for Rage upkeep.
• Constitution + 2 (Already Applied)

duf5poxPv6JyNbYX.label: Easy Avoidance Saving Throw
duf5poxPv6JyNbYX.onSave: Don't chase down the creature who's blood is on your lips.

vQkkhQsFAcbDLMKg.onSave: Don't chase down the creature who's blood is on your lips.
vQkkhQsFAcbDLMKg.label: Moderate Avoidance Saving Throw

LJtFoAmFmKh5pkrE.onSave: Don't chase down the creature who's blood is on your lips.
LJtFoAmFmKh5pkrE.label: Difficult Avoidance Saving Throw

PNXIYdxCF5E4JWuX.onSave: Don't chase down the creature who's blood is on your lips.
PNXIYdxCF5E4JWuX.label: Hard Avoidance Saving Throw

1mJ47OENkY3NTV85.onSave: Don't chase down the creature who's blood is on your lips.
1mJ47OENkY3NTV85.label: Really Hard Avoidance Saving Throw

sRHegF5o8rQTJCgZ.onSave: Don't chase down the creature who's blood is on your lips.
sRHegF5o8rQTJCgZ.label: Nearly Impossible Avoidance Saving Throw

jxW88iE6HZImQVhE.name: Blood in the Water Movement Increase
jxW88iE6HZImQVhE.description: • If Káshi gets a creature's blood on his lips he gains 10 feet of walking/swimming movement during his turn to rush toward that creature, taking disadvantage on all saving throws if those 10 feet of movement are used to reach his prey.

system.description:
• If Káshi gets a creature's blood on his lips he gains 10 feet of walking/swimming movement during his turn to rush toward that creature, taking disadvantage on all saving throws if those 10 feet of movement are used to reach his prey.

    • Roll with advantage to avoid going after your own team.

    • Roll with disadvantage to avoid going after an adversary.

    • Depending on the situation, the DM will tell you the difficulty class of the Intelligence Saving Throw.

      • Easy 5, Moderate 10, Difficult 15, Hard 20, Really Hard 25, Nearly Impossible 30

        • On a fail, Káshi must focus solely on that creature.

          • He has disadvantage on all saving throws during those final 10 feet of extra movement.

effects.name: Blood in the Water +10 Movement
effects.description: • Káshi gains 10 feet of movement during his turn to rush toward that creature, taking disadvantage on all saving throws if those 10 feet of movement are used to reach his prey.

system.description:
• If Blood in the Water is active, Hákarl may use his Lethal Jaws and then Claw Slash immediately after with advantage.

      • The creature is considered Maimed, Disoriented, and Frightened, and thus they suffer a penalty on their weapon attacks equal to half your proficiency bonus (Rounded down) and have disadvantage on all saving throws until your next turn.

O4OMvI5mATJsWMAY.name: Claw Slash
O4OMvI5mATJsWMAY.description: • Hákarl slashes with his claws at an enemy.

system.description:
• If Blood in the Water is active and there's a creature between Hákarl and that creature, Hákarl may freely use Claw Slash against the creature in-between him and the other.

      • If it lands, he may force the creature to make a Strength contest.

        • On a failed save, Hákarl grabs them and hurls them 10 feet out of his path and they land prone.

        • The creature can't be 2 sizes larger than him or one size and wearing heavy armor.

        • If the creature is smaller than him they have disadvantage on the saving throw.

• Immune to grapple when covered in water by creatures less than 2 sizes larger than you.

    • Magical grapples can still affect you, however, but you gain advantage against their attempts.

  • While covered in water, you heal 1d4 per turn.

K8zdvXoHOE4AWJ2A.onSave: Avoid being Knocked Prone and Lethal Jaw Bonus Action
K8zdvXoHOE4AWJ2A.label: Pounce Saving Throw

system.description:
• If Hákarl moves at least 20 feet during his movement, he may lunge at a creature 10 feet from him to do his attack.

    • They must roll DC 17 Strength or be knocked prone.

      • If they are knocked prone, Hákarl may use Lethal Jaws as a bonus attack.

• At 1st level, so long as you aren't wearing armor, your AC is equal to 13 + Your Constitution modifier.

    • If your Dexterity modifier is +4 or higher, you may instead have your AC be equal to 10 + Your Dexterity modifier + Your Constitution modifier.

    • You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

effects.name: Unarmored AC
effects.description:
• At 1st level, so long as you aren't wearing armor, your AC is equal to 13 + Your Constitution modifier.

    • If your Dexterity modifier is +4 or higher, you may instead have your AC be equal to 10 + Your Dexterity modifier + Your Constitution modifier.

    • You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

system.description: • You can breathe in and out of water.

• Beginning at 2nd level, the divine energy flowing within you begins to manifest.

    • You gain 2 Divine Exultations.

      • Found here:

        • Hákarl - Exultations, Enchantments, Miracles, Tattoos, Savageries, Combat Traits.docx

      • You learn additional Divine Exultations at certain levels, as shown in the Demigod Class Table.

      • Some Divine Exultations have prerequisites that you must meet first in order to learn them.

        • If an Exultation has a level prerequisite, it refers to your Demigod Barbarian Level

      • Whenever you gain a level in this class, you may replace one Divine Exultation you know with another that you meet the prerequisites for, unless otherwise stated.

 

More Detailed Break Down of this feature below:

  • These help define you as a Demigod and build up your power.

  • When you choose 1, you technically may only choose one that is shared or one for each Demigod unshared.

  • You may replace any number of these after a Long rest unless otherwise stated.

• At 1st Level, you are able to call upon a weapon worthy of your divine nature that causes damage according to your Divine Damage Type (Necrotic).

    • On your turn you can summon your Divine Implement  to your hand (No action required)

      • Your Divine Implement is a martial weapon you are proficient in.

      • it deals your choice of bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage (You choose when you gain this feature).

        • It is considered a magical weapon for the purposes of overcoming resistances and immunities.

        • You use your Divine ability Score for any roll involving your Divine Implement.

      • The Divine Implement disappears if it is more than 5-feet away from you..

        • It also disappears if you use this feature again, dismiss the weapon (No action required), die, or take a short/long rest.

        • You may augment your Divine Implement with things known as Divine Enchantments.

          • Found Here: Hákarl - Exultations, Enchantments, Miracles, Tattoos, Savageries, Combat Traits.docx

          • Once you choose an enchantment it can not be changed until you create a new Divine Implement.

          • You begin with 1 enchantment known, which must be chosen from the Starting Enchantments list.

            • Your Starting Enchantment also determines your Divine Implements damage die.

          • You learn new Divine Enchantments as shown in the Enchantments Known column in the Demigod Barbarian Class Table.

 

Greater Detailed Break Down of the Divine Enchantments Below:

  • At 1st level for your very first enchantment, you must choose an enchantment designated “Starting Enchantment”

    • This will determine your Divine Implement weapon damage die and properties.

    • These weapons cause damage according to your DIVINE DAMAGE TYPE

• Upon reaching 2nd level, when sharing control with Káshi, 3 Ancient Tattoos glow with a light similar to metal being pulled from the forge, but vary in color.

    • 3 Ancient Tattoos appear at level 2

      • Found here:

        • Hákarl - Exultations, Enchantments, Miracles, Tattoos, Savageries, Combat Traits.docx

      • You learn additional Ancient Tattoos shown in the Tattoos column in the Demigod Barbarian Class Table.

    • Tattoos grant you two benefits:

      • Their innate benefit and their Rage benefit, a Barbarian can use a Tattoo’s innate benefit at any time, even when not sharing control with Káshi, while the Rage benefit is only active while the Barbarian is Raging.

    • Whenever you take a long rest, Káshi may exchange one Tattoo you know for another.

 

For Detailed Instructions, Read Below:

  • Ancient Tattoos
    • Káshi augments Hákarl with Ancient Tattoos that are either of Draconic or Giant origin.
    • The Ancient Tattoos glow on Hákarl’s skin when under Káshi’s influence.
  • Tattoo Ability Score
    • Ancient Tattoos are not inherently magical.
    • They are fueled by mysterious primal energies generated directly from Káshi.
    • These energies use your Constitution score for determining DC's and attack rolls.
  • Tattoo Attacks
    • If a feature says it makes a Tattoo Attack, the attack roll uses Your Proficiency Bonus + Your Constitution modifier.
    • Unless otherwise specified, Tattoo attacks always add your Constitution modifier to their damage roll.
  •  Tattoo DC
    • If a feature forces another creature to make a saving throw, the DC is equal to 8 + Your Proficiency Bonus + Your Constitution modifier.
    • If a Tattoo has Passive on it, it begins and ends with your Rage, otherwise it has a limited number of uses during each Rage.

• Also at 2nd level, Káshi returns the pain you endure twice fold to those who face you, giving you both the Agony Pool and Savagery feature.

    • Agony Pool

      • Whenever you suffer damage, you may add the damage taken to a temporary pool known as your Agony Pool.

        • At the end of your turn, all damage stored in your Agony Pool is lost and the pool returns to 0.

        • If you regain hit points, you lose an equal amount of damage stored in your Agony Pool equal to the hit points regained (Your Agony Pool can not go below 0)

    • Savagery

      • Using the pain stored from your Agony Pool, you are capable of producing powerful effects known as Savageries.

        • You start at level 2 knowing two of these techniques, found here:

          • Hákarl - Exultations, Enchantments, Miracles, Tattoos, Savageries, Combat Traits.docx

          • You learn additional Savageries as shown in the Savageries Known column in the Demigod Barbarian Class Table.

          • Each Savagery has its own rules detailed in its description.

            • Often they will require some kind of action (Whether it be bonus action, reaction, action or in place of an attack)

            • In order to use them, you must first expend an appropriate amount of points from your Agony Pool.

          • Whenever you take a long rest, you may exchange the Savageries you wish Káshi to perform for an equal amount of other Savageries.

 

More Detailed Information Below:

  • Immensely powerful techniques Káshi fuels through Hákarl’s pain are known as Savageries.
  • Hákarl can expend the damage stored within their Agony Pool to power these savageries.
  • Savageries refer to the damage stored within your Agony Pool as Agony Points.
  • Your Savagery DC is equal to 8 + Your Proficiency bonus + Your Strength modifier.

• Also at 3rd level, Káshi has bestowed upon you the Principles of Wrath Combat Traits, to further manifest his Wrath in unique ways.

    • You may choose a Combat Trait from the options found here:

      • Hákarl - Exultations, Enchantments, Miracles, Tattoos, Savageries, Combat Traits.docx

      • Some Combat Traits have a level prerequisite in order to choose that feature.

      • You learn additional Combat Traits as defined in the Demigod Barbarian Class Table.

      • Whenever you take a long rest, you may exchange the Combat Traits you wish Káshi to execute for an equal amount of other Combat Traits.

 

More Detailed Information Below:

  • These traits can be used as often as you wish while under the influence of Káshi’s Rage.
    • They should reflect the type of Beached Sea Monster you want to be.
    • You must have the Prerequisite level to choose some of these traits.

ebz6NBD3idH4TFIf.name: Roiling Wrath - Lightning Damage

activation.reactionTrigger: Struck by a melee attack (Expanded Storm - Range up to 15 feet from you)

hZcD2AL39ChpouQp.onSave: They take half damage and aren't pushed back
hZcD2AL39ChpouQp.label: Roiling Wrath Save

ebz6NBD3idH4TFIf.description:
• The creature takes lightning  damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much on a success according to the Demigod Barbarian Class Table (1d6).

    • Additionally on a failed saving throw, if you chose lightning, it pushes them 5-feet away from you in a stright line (Expanded Storm, pushes them 15 feet instead).

vHGmbxOd4YmWVka1.name: Roiling Wrath - Thunder Damage

activation.reactionTrigger: Struck by a melee attack (Expanded Storm - Range up to 15 feet from you)

hZcD2AL39ChpouQp.onSave: They take half damage and aren't stunned or pushed back.
hZcD2AL39ChpouQp.label: Roiling Wrath Save

vHGmbxOd4YmWVka1.description:
• The creature takes thunder damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much on a success according to the Demigod Barbarian Class Table (1d6).

    • Additionally, on a failed saving throw it knocks them prone (Expanded Storm, pushes them 10 feet away from you in a stright line).

system.description:
• At 3rd level, while under Káshi’s Influence, you are one with the storm and the storm is one with you.

    • When a creature hits you with a melee attack, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. (Expanded Storm, increases the range of the attack to 15 feet away, adding ranged attacks to Roiling Wrath's Influence).

      • The creature takes lightning or thunder damage (Your choice) on a failed saving throw, or half as much on a success according to the Demigod Barbarian Class Table (1d6).

        • Additionally on a failed saving throw, if you chose lightning, it pushes them 5-feet away from you in a straight line (Expanded Storm, pushes them 15 feet instead).

          • Alternatively, on a failed saving throw, if you chose thunder it knocks them prone (Expanded Storm, pushes them 10 feet away).

• STRENGTHEN WEAPON - Secondary Enchantment

    • Your Divine Implements damage die increases by 1 stage.

      • If its damage die is already at 1d12/2d6, you instead add an additional 1d4 to the damage and repeat this process.

        • 1d4 -> 1d6

        • 1d6 -> 1d8

        • 1d8 -> 1d10

        • 1d10 -> 1d12

        • 1d12/2d6 -> 1d12/2d6 + 1d4

        • 1d12/2d6 + 1d4 -> 1d12/2d6 + 1d6

      • You may select this enchantment any number of times you want.

HoOjNeGfdLcclOJD.name: Hákarl’s Trident Melee - Strengthened
HoOjNeGfdLcclOJD.description:
• Damage: 1d12 + 1d4 (Strengthened Weapon)

  • Damage Type: Piercing

  •  Range: 10 feet

system.description:
• Hákarl’s Trident - Divine Implement - COLOSSAL WEAPON

    • Damage: 1d12 (Strengthened Weapon: add 1d4)

    • Damage Type: Piercing or Necrotic

    • Item Rarity: Magical Artifact

    • Properties: Heavy, Two-Handed

    • Melle Range: 10-15 feet
    • Weight: 4

    • This was the one and only thing Hákarl was found with.

      • Its uses besides fighting are unknown.

• You gain an additional hit die, and your maximum hit points increase appropriately.

  • You may take this Exultation as many times as you wish.
• If a creature has suffered Lightning or Thunder damage since the beginning of your last turn, they have disadvantage on saving throws against you.

• The range at which you can use Roiling Wrath and how far it can push creatures are both increased by 10-feet.

  • You may take this Exultation as many times as you wish.

• If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.
  • You may use your Disarm maneuver to attempt to knock an item or weapon from a creature's hand.
    • The target must be within your reach and be holding an item (either carried or wielded).
      • The target makes a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC.
        • The target has advantage if it is larger than you or holding the item with two or more hands
        • Alternatively, a target smaller than you has disadvantage.
          • On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and the target drops the item in its space.

• Allows a character to evade opportunity attacks for the rest of their turn.
    • It’s a defensive tactic used when you want to safely move away from an enemy without risking a free swing.

• While you cannot grapple a creature two or more size categories larger than you, you can grab onto it.
    • By jumping onto its back or climbing up a limb, you can make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against the creature's maneuver DC to cling to or balance upon its body.
      • On a success, you move into the creature's space and can move upon its body as if it is difficult terrain.
  • While grabbing onto a larger creature, you gain advantage on attack rolls against it.
    • The larger creature may be able to attack you as normal, depending on its limbs or attacks.
      • It can also use an action or replace one of its attacks on its turn to try to dislodge you, such as shaking you loose or bashing you against a wall, forcing you to make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against its maneuver DC or fall prone into the nearest space adjacent to the creature, taking its basic melee damage in the process.
  • If the creature chooses to roll over in order to dislodge you, it becomes prone, but you have disadvantage on the saving throw to hang on.

• If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.
  • You can use the Grapple maneuver to grab or wrestle a creature
    • You must have at least one free hand to attempt a grapple, your target must be within your reach, and the target must be no more than one size category larger than you.
      • The target makes a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC.
        • On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and the target becomes grappled.
          • In addition to things that end the condition, you can release the target at any time (no action required).
  • Escaping a Grapple
    • While grappled, a creature can use its action to attempt to escape. It must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC.
  • Moving a Grappled Creature
    • When you move, you can drag or carry the grappled creature with you.
      • When you do so, your Speed is halved, unless the creature's weight is within your carrying capacity and you are not encumbered by bulky items.
  • Freeing a Grappled Creature
    • You can use the Grapple maneuver to try to free another grappled or restrained creature.
      • The creature grappling or restraining the target makes a Strength saving throw against your maneuver DC.
        • If it fails the saving throw, the grappled or restrained creature is freed.
        • Additionally, you may move the freed creature 5 feet in any direction.

• If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.
  • You can use the Knockdown maneuver to trip or push a creature down.
    • The target must be within your reach and be no more than one size category larger than you.
    • The target makes a Strength saving throw against your maneuver DC.
      • On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and knock the target prone.

• You can use an action or bonus action to make an Overrun maneuver to move through a hostile creature's space by forcing your way past.
    • Make a Strength saving throw against the target's maneuver DC.
      • On a success, you deal basic melee damage and can move through the hostile creature's space once this turn.
      • The creature can choose to let you pass instead of rolling.
      • You have advantage if you are larger than the target, or disadvantage if you are smaller.
      • If you are two or more sizes smaller than the target, you can move through the hostile creature's space without making a save.
      • You still provoke opportunity attacks if you move beyond a creature's reach.

• If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.
  • You can use the Shove maneuver to push a creature away.
    • The target must be within your reach and be no more than one size category larger than you.
      • The target makes a Strength saving throw against your maneuver DC.
        • On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and push the target a number of feet away from you equal to 5 + 5 for every 5 points it failed its saving throw by.
          • You can move the creature in any direction away from you (to the side, forward, or diagonally away).
    • A creature that is shoved off of a precipice is propelled off of whatever it is standing on -- it does not receive any saving throw or ability check to grab onto something to avoid falling down below.

• A creature can use its action to eat one berry.
    • Eating a berry restores 1 hit point, and the berry provides enough nourishment to sustain a creature for one day.
    • The berries lose their potency if they have not been consumed within 24 hours of the casting of this spell.

• FLYING DRAGON WITH A FIERY, SMOKING, EMBER GLOW - ONE USE PER RAGE

    • Upon entering your rage, you may choose to grow dragon's scales across your flesh and dragon's wings sprout from your back.

      • You cannot manifest the wings while wearing armor, and they will destroy any clothing not made to accommodate them.

      • You gain a +1 bonus to your AC. Everytime your fury die size increases (Levels 7, 13, 19, 25) this bonus is increased by 1 (+2 bonus, +3 bonus, +4 bonus, and +5 bonus respectively)

      • You gain a flying speed equal to your swimming speed.

    • If you did not choose to do this as a reaction to entering Rage, you may do this as a bonus action.

    • You cannot benefit from this effect and the JOTUN TATTOO effect at the same time.

    • If all you have is DRACONIC Tattoos, they all apply and trigger at once ignoring the rules of use)

eaMBFdWrwtrsQJMu.name: Unstoppable Force -3 Agony Pool
eaMBFdWrwtrsQJMu.description: • You must choose to do this before you make your movement, and for every 3 points expended from your Agony Pool you add an additional 2 feet to your normal movement.

system.description:
• During Blood in the Water, you may expend any amount from your Agony Pool to move forward with nothing capable of standing in your way.

    • You must choose to do this before you make your movement, and for every 3 points expended from your Agony Pool you add an additional 2 feet to your normal movement.

      • During your movement, you are capable of walking through solid material and any object during this movement (Even through things such as a Wall of Force)

        • Objects and material you walk through leave a hole in your shape behind as you pass through them.

        • If you attempt to walk into a creature under the effects of Immovable Object, both effects end and you both become Stunned until the end of each of your turns.

• Once, on each of your turns, when you make a weapon attack, you can make another attack with the same weapon against a different creature that is within 5 feet of the original target as long as they are within range of your weapon.

• When you use your Agony Pool in any way, and you decide there is a creature on the battlefield that is unworthy of your attention, you may use a bonus action to instantly kill a creature within 30 feet of you with a wink if the following apply:

    • The DM has said something along the lines of, they’re hanging by a limb.

    • They are not Legendary creatures.

    • Their Challenge Rating is equal to or less than the amount from the Agony Pool that was expended by the triggering effect.

      • You may add whatever is left in your Agony Pool to pull this off.

• INSTEAD OF GLOWING, THIS TATTOO IS A BLACK VOID ON YOUR FLESH - ONE USE PER RAGE

    • If you activate this tattoo as a bonus action or via Darastrix, you can point to a space within 30 feet from you and all creatures and objects within a 10 foot radius are pulled to that point.

      • They take force damage equal to a number of Fury Die equaling the number of other creatures or objects.

        • They cannot take a number of Fury Die over your normal amount of Fury Die.

• At 1st level, you hear the voice of Káshi and may share control with him to initiate Rage, gaining the following benefits while active:

    • Whenever you make a Strength ability check or saving throw, you may roll 1d4 and add it to the check.

      • This die increases as you gain levels, as shown in the Fury Die column in the Demigod Barbarian class table.

    • Whenever you hit with a melee weapon attack, you deal 1d4 additional damage of the weapons damage type.

      • This damage die increases as you gain levels, as shown in the Fury Die column in the Demigod Barbarian Class Table.

    • You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

    • You cannot cast spells or concentrate on spell effects.

    • Your Rage ends if you are incapacitated, or if your turn ends and you haven't made an attack against a creature or taken damage.

      • Though you can freely pass from sharing control with Yákovná to sharing control with Káshi without an action, Káshi has a hard time relenting.

        • As a bonus action, you may roll a strength save depending on how difficult the DM believes it should be to switch sharing control back to Yákovná.

        • This is near impossible under certain circumstances or abilities (Blood in the Water).

      • However, sharing control is hard for Káshi and it puts a strain on him and must come to an end after a number of rounds passes equal to your Constitution modifier (Minimum of 1)

        • Once he relents, Rage ends.

          • You cannot share control with him for a number of rounds equal to the number of rounds Rage was active.

• GLOWING RED DRAGON THAT ERUPTS IN FIRE  - ONE USE PER RAGE

    • If you activate this tattoo as a bonus action or via Darastrix, until your next turn, when you hit a target with a melee weapon attack or damage them with Savagery, you may convert any amount of the damage into fire damage.

      • The fire damage you deal ignores resistance to fire damage.

        • If they are immune to fire damage, this does not apply.

      • If the target suffers any of this damage, roll your fury die.

        • At the start of their next turn, they suffer damage equal to the number rolled.

          • You do not add your Constitution modifier to this damage.

          • This can stack with itself.

effects.name: Unarmored AC
effects.description:
• At 1st level, so long as you aren't wearing armor, your AC is equal to 13 + Your Constitution modifier.

    • If your Dexterity modifier is +4 or higher, you may instead have your AC be equal to 10 + Your Dexterity modifier + Your Constitution modifier.

    • You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

introduce-me.flavor: Shark Berserker - Káshi - Demigod of the Ocean Depths
